intro: Crucifera impatiens, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in a range of colors, including purple, blue, and white. The plant is native to the Americas and is often found growing in disturbed soils along roadsides and in gardens. It is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often reaching heights of up to 6 feet. Its rapid growth and attractive blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
